TECHNIQUE.name: Generic CFEngine Command variable definition
TECHNIQUE.DESCRIPTION: Configures a generic CFEngine variable in a common bundle from the output of an executable, to be used in another Technique. This Technique does nothing by itself, you must reuse the variable(s) you will create here in another Technique with the form: $(generic_cmd_var_def.variablename)

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_COMMAND_VARIABLE_NAME
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Variable name for the output of this command

REGEX.error: Please enter a valid CFEngine variable name

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_COMMAND_VARIABLE_BINARY
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Executable whose output is to be stored as a variable
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Be careful, the absolute path to the binary must be specified here. Example: /bin/uname instead of uname

SELECT1.NAME: GENERIC_COMMAND_VARIABLE_SHELL
SELECT1.DESCRIPTION: Use system shell or CFEngine system
SELECT1.LONGDESCRIPTION: Use of a shell has both resource and security consequences. A shell consumes an extra process and inherits environment variables, reads commands from files and performs other actions beyond the control of CFEngine. If one does not need shell functionality such as piping through multiple commands then it is best to manage without it.
